column4: Could anyone say how well one could trust chkrootkit for a medium-sized university server?
you should run it off of a live cd or along with rootkit hunter
rootkit hunter, is that an offical package to use?
if you run it off of a live cd then it won't be corrupted by any malicious programs that target it
make sure you run the updates before scanning
Are there any other vital security checks for establishing if there has been intrusion/infection?
Running bastille, wireshark and nessus at the moment
wow...that's much better than me.  i wish my boss let me make the server more secure. you can start by checking your logs.
You know of any good things as pre-cautions? Heard about AIDE or something like that..
You slap your boss with a large trout and he'll come around..
change ssh port or enable something like fail2ban for ssh brute force attempts. look into monit and munin.  good descriptions on howtoforge.com.  we have many trout in alaska.
disable FTP and enforce SFTP. use SSH keys instead of passwords, and you can chroot non-vital ssh users
Would it be advisable to encourage the use of SSH key's rather to ~70 SSH users?
most importantly, keep a list of installed apps and update them regularly.  using keys for 70+ users won't be easy.  just make sure their passwords are good.
iptables is another useful tool. again, howtoforge.com has many good security tutorials and an excellent message board for questions.
brilliant info, thank's a million mate ;)
no problem.  good luck against the constant barrage of intrusion attempts.
